chart_metadata.description: volsync is a storage backup and synchronisation tool.
chart_metadata.name: volsync

groups.name: Image
groups.description:
Configured the images to be used for the Chart.
It's wise to use "digest pinned" tags and to avoid using "latest".

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/#images

groups.name: General
groups.description:
For TrueNAS SCALE We've grouped a number of settings here, that all effact how apps run in general.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
  - https://truecharts.org/common/global/
  - https://truecharts.org/common/#tz
  - https://truecharts.org/common/podoptions/
  - Image Pull Secrets

groups.name: Workload
groups.description:
These settings configure how the actual Pods and containers are running.
Generally, on SCALE, we only expose a limited subset of these settings for the primary workload and container.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/workload/
- https://truecharts.org/common/container/

groups.name: App Configuration
groups.description:
Every application has different values that may be required to run or have multiple options that the user may choose to enable or disable to change the behavior of the application.
Most options should have a Tooltip (Circled Question Mark) to further describe said option.

To find more information, lookup your chart-specific documentation in the Charts List: https://truecharts.org/charts/description-list/

groups.name: Services
groups.description:
Service and Networking options for any applications are contained here.
Some applications may have complicated networking setups with multiple options or some may have no options here at all.

Options here include the service and port configurations for the application, and more may be enabled or changed under the Advanced Settings and Show Expert Config boxes.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/service/

groups.name: Networking
groups.description:
Contains advanced networking options that are not actively supported by the TrueCharts team.
Currently only contains scaleExternalInterfaces.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/scaleexternalinterface/

groups.name: Persistence
groups.description:
Many applications will have certain options for storage to be configurable by the user, the main two being PVC and hostpath but may include other types.
This storage is called Persistence since it is not deleted upon restart or upgrade of an application.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/persistence/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/nfs-share/
- https://truecharts.org/general/faq/#why-pvc-is-recommended-over-hostpath

groups.name: Ingress
groups.description:
Ingress (more commonly known as Reverse Proxy) settings can be configured here. This is how Kubernetes connects your Applications in containers to FQDNs (fully qualified domain names).
If you choose to enable this you must have a "Ingress Provider" aka "Reverse Proxy" installed (We highly advice Traefik: https://truecharts.org/charts/premium/traefik/)
It also requiresa DNS service to actually resolve the DNS name of the FQDN specified.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/ingress/

groups.name: SecurityContext
groups.description:
The security settings for each application and/or permissions that each application may have for the files/directories created.
Each application will come with predefined permissions but users may want to change certain setting depending on their usage or capabilities.

Unless necessary users are advised to keep this section mostly to defaults.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/securitycontext/

groups.name: Resources
groups.description:
Resources limits that have been defined by each application are in this section.
Most will have a specific default that some users may want to change based on their specific hardware or needs.

This also contains the options to mount GPUs or, more precisely, "request" GPU's to be mounted.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/resources/

groups.name: Devices
groups.description:
These are special "mountpoints" that can be used to mount miscelanious USB and PCI devices using special hostPath mounts.
For clearity we've decided to seperate this from persistence on SCALE.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/persistence/device/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/pci-passthrough/

groups.name: Middlewares
groups.description: Traefik Middlewares

groups.name: StorageClass
groups.description:
StorageClasses define where to storage Storage.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:

groups.name: Metrics
groups.description:
Contains options to configure Prometheus metrics for the application.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/metrics/

groups.name: Addons
groups.description:
Addons that are supplied by the TrueCharts team to add additional capabilities for users to use on top of the application’s defaults.
Things included here are VPN addons, Codeserver for editing files inside the application’s container, Netshoot for network troubelshooting, etc.

Generally not required for use but may be necessary or usefull at times for specific applications.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/addons/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/vpn-setup/

groups.name: Experimental
groups.description:
Experimental Configuration Options
Often these are not fully flushed-out, could randomly break or might not work at-all.

groups.name: Postgresql
groups.description:
For Postgresql we use "CloudNative-PG" as a backend, which has to be installed first.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/cnpg/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/sql-export/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/recover-cnpg/

groups.name: Dependencies
groups.description: contains dependency setting for which we, currently, do not have seperate catagories (yet)

groups.name: Documentation
groups.description:
We added this section to make everyone aware that OpenSource isn't always easy.
It doesn't keep existing without signficant ongoing support, so please consider supporting TrueCharts and other OpenSource projects.

Before installing, be sure you've followed the https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/getting-started/
We would also advice going over our https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/scale-intro/
and many of the other documentation pages...

attrs.label: Stop All
attrs.description: Stops All Running pods and hibernates cnpg

attrs.label: Replicas (Advanced)
attrs.description: Set the number of Replicas

attrs.label: Extra Environment Variables
attrs.description: Please be aware that some variables are set in the background, adding duplicates here might cause issues or prevent the app from starting...

attrs.label: Show Advanced Settings
attrs.description: Advanced settings are not covered by TrueCharts Support

attrs.label: Use Cert-Manager clusterIssuer
attrs.description: add the name of your Cert-Manager clusterIssuer here for automatic tls certificates.

attrs.label: Cluster Certificate (Advanced)
attrs.description: Add the name of your cluster-wide certificate, that you set up in the ClusterIssuer chart.

attrs.label: Integrations
attrs.description: Connect ingress with other charts

attrs.label: Traefik
attrs.description: Connect ingress with Traefik

attrs.label: certManager
attrs.description: Connect ingress with certManager

attrs.label: certificateIssuer
attrs.description: defaults to chartname

attrs.label: Homepage
attrs.description: Connect ingress with Homepage

attrs.label: Name
attrs.description: defaults to chartname

attrs.label: Description
attrs.description: defaults to chart description

attrs.label: runAsUser
attrs.description: The UserID of the user running the application

attrs.label: runAsGroup
attrs.description: The groupID of the user running the application

attrs.label: Process User ID - PUID
attrs.description: When supported by the container, this sets the User ID running the Application Process. Not supported by all Apps

attrs.label: UMASK
attrs.description: When supported by the container, this sets the UMASK for the App. Not supported by all Apps

attrs.label: Show Advanced Settings
attrs.description: Advanced settings are not covered by TrueCharts Support

attrs.label: fsGroup
attrs.description: The group that should own ALL storage.

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: 1000m means 1 hyperthread. Detailed info: https://truecharts.org/manual/SCALE/validation

attrs.label: RAM
attrs.description: 1Gi means 1 Gibibyte RAM. Detailed info: https://truecharts.org/manual/SCALE/validation

attrs.label: CPU
attrs.description: 1000m means 1 hyperthread. Detailed info: https://truecharts.org/manual/SCALE/validation

attrs.label: RAM
attrs.description: 1Gi means 1 Gibibyte RAM. Detailed info: https://truecharts.org/manual/SCALE/validation

attrs.label: (Advanced) Type of Storage
attrs.description: Sets the persistence type

attrs.label: Host Device Path
attrs.description: Path to the device on the host system

attrs.label: Container Device Path
attrs.description: Path inside the container the device is mounted

attrs.label: Enabled
attrs.description: Enable Prometheus Metrics

subquestions.label: PrometheusRule
subquestions.description: Enable and configure Prometheus Rules for the App.

attrs.label: Enabled
attrs.description: Enable Prometheus Metrics

attrs.label: Service Type
attrs.description: ClusterIP's are only internally available and Loadbalancer exposes the service using the system loadbalancer

attrs.label: LoadBalancer IP
attrs.description: MetalLB Only: Selects the Loadbalancer IP to expose on. Required when using PortalButton with MetalLB

attrs.label: Traefik
attrs.description: Connect ingress with Traefik

attrs.label: certManager
attrs.description: Connect ingress with certManager

attrs.label: certificateIssuer
attrs.description: defaults to chartname

subquestions.label: Show Advanced Settings
subquestions.description: Advanced settings are not covered by TrueCharts Support

attrs.label: Use Cert-Manager clusterIssuer
attrs.description: add the name of your cert-manager clusterIssuer here for automatic tls certificates.

attrs.label: Cluster Certificate (Advanced)
attrs.description: Add the name of your cluster-wide certificate, that you set up in the ClusterIssuer chart.

attrs.label: Authentication Username (Optional)
attrs.description: Authentication Username, Optional

attrs.label: Authentication Password
attrs.description: Authentication Credentials

attrs.label: Authentication Key
attrs.description: Provide an auth key to automatically authenticate the node as your user account.

attrs.label: Auth Once
attrs.description: Only attempt to log in if not already logged in.

attrs.label: Accept DNS
attrs.description: Accept DNS configuration from the admin console.

attrs.label: Userspace
attrs.description: Userspace Networking mode allows running Tailscale where you do not have access to create a VPN tunnel device.

attrs.label: Routes
attrs.description: Expose physical subnet routes to your entire Tailscale network.

attrs.label: Destination IP
attrs.description: Tells the DNAT mechanism which Destination IP to set in the IP header, and where to send packets that are matched.

attrs.label: Sock5 Server
attrs.description: The address on which to listen for SOCKS5 proxying into the tailscale net.

attrs.label: Outbound HTTP Proxy Listen
attrs.description: The address on which to listen for HTTP proxying into the tailscale net.

attrs.label: Extra Args
attrs.description: Extra Args

attrs.label: Tailscale Daemon Extra Args
attrs.description: Tailscale Daemon Extra Args

attrs.label: Killswitch Excluded IPv4 networks
attrs.description: List of Killswitch Excluded IPv4 Addresses

attrs.label: Killswitch Excluded IPv6 networks
attrs.description: List of Killswitch Excluded IPv6 Addresses

questions.label: Please read the documentation at https://truecharts.org
Please consider supporting TrueCharts, see https://truecharts.org/sponsor

1.0.7.app_readme:
volsync is a storage backup and synchronisation tool.

This App is supplied by TrueCharts, for more information visit the manual: https://truecharts.org/charts/incubator/volsync

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!
1.0.7.detailed_readme:
title: README

General Info

TrueCharts can be installed as both normal Helm Charts or as TrueNAS SCALE Apps. Both solutions are fully supported, but we heavily advice the use of normal Helm Charts where possible

For more information about this Chart, please check the docs on the TrueCharts website

This chart is not maintained by the upstream project and any issues with the chart should be raised here

Installation

Helm-Chart installation

To install TrueCharts Helm charts using Helm, you can use our OCI Repository.

helm install mychart oci://tccr.io/truecharts/CHARTNAME

For more information on how to install TrueCharts Helm charts, checkout the instructions on the website: https://truecharts.org/helm/

TrueNAS SCALE Apps

For more information on how to use TrueCharts as TrueNAS SCALE Apps, please checkout the quick-start guides for TrueNAS SCALE.

Configuration Options

To view the chart specific options, please view Values.yaml included in the chart.

All our Charts use a shared "common" library chart that contains most of the templating and options. For the complete overview of all available options, please checkout the documentation for them on the website: https://truecharts.org/common/

Chart Specific Guides and information

All our charts have dedicated documentation pages. The documentation for this chart can be found here: https://truecharts.org/charts/incubator/volsync

Support

  • See the Website
  • Check our Discord
  • Open a issue

Sponsor TrueCharts

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!

All Rights Reserved - The TrueCharts Project

- https://truecharts.org/common/persistence/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/nfs-share/
- https://truecharts.org/general/faq/#why-pvc-is-recommended-over-hostpath

groups.name: Ingress
groups.description:
Ingress (more commonly known as Reverse Proxy) settings can be configured here. This is how Kubernetes connects your Applications in containers to FQDNs (fully qualified domain names).
If you choose to enable this you must have a "Ingress Provider" aka "Reverse Proxy" installed (We highly advice Traefik: https://truecharts.org/charts/premium/traefik/)
It also requiresa DNS service to actually resolve the DNS name of the FQDN specified.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/ingress/

groups.name: SecurityContext
groups.description:
The security settings for each application and/or permissions that each application may have for the files/directories created.
Each application will come with predefined permissions but users may want to change certain setting depending on their usage or capabilities.

Unless necessary users are advised to keep this section mostly to defaults.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/securitycontext/

groups.name: Resources
groups.description:
Resources limits that have been defined by each application are in this section.
Most will have a specific default that some users may want to change based on their specific hardware or needs.

This also contains the options to mount GPUs or, more precisely, "request" GPU's to be mounted.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/resources/

groups.name: Devices
groups.description:
These are special "mountpoints" that can be used to mount miscelanious USB and PCI devices using special hostPath mounts.
For clearity we've decided to seperate this from persistence on SCALE.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/persistence/device/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/pci-passthrough/

groups.name: Middlewares
groups.description: Traefik Middlewares

groups.name: StorageClass
groups.description:
StorageClasses define where to storage Storage.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:

groups.name: Metrics
groups.description:
Contains options to configure Prometheus metrics for the application.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/metrics/

groups.name: Addons
groups.description:
Addons that are supplied by the TrueCharts team to add additional capabilities for users to use on top of the application’s defaults.
Things included here are VPN addons, Codeserver for editing files inside the application’s container, Netshoot for network troubelshooting, etc.

Generally not required for use but may be necessary or usefull at times for specific applications.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/addons/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/vpn-setup/

groups.name: Experimental
groups.description:
Experimental Configuration Options
Often these are not fully flushed-out, could randomly break or might not work at-all.

groups.name: Postgresql
groups.description:
For Postgresql we use "CloudNative-PG" as a backend, which has to be installed first.

Checkout the following documentation for more information:
- https://truecharts.org/common/cnpg/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/sql-export/
- https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/recover-cnpg/

groups.name: Dependencies
groups.description: contains dependency setting for which we, currently, do not have seperate catagories (yet)

groups.name: Documentation
groups.description:
We added this section to make everyone aware that OpenSource isn't always easy.
It doesn't keep existing without signficant ongoing support, so please consider supporting TrueCharts and other OpenSource projects.

Before installing, be sure you've followed the https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/getting-started/
We would also advice going over our https://truecharts.org/scale/guides/scale-intro/
and many of the other documentation pages...

0.0.1.app_readme:
volsync is a storage backup and synchronisation tool.

This App is supplied by TrueCharts, for more information visit the manual: https://truecharts.org/charts/incubator/volsync

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!
0.0.1.detailed_readme:
title: README

General Info

TrueCharts can be installed as both normal Helm Charts or as TrueNAS SCALE Apps. Both solutions are fully supported, but we heavily advice the use of normal Helm Charts where possible

For more information about this Chart, please check the docs on the TrueCharts website

This chart is not maintained by the upstream project and any issues with the chart should be raised here

Installation

Helm-Chart installation

To install TrueCharts Helm charts using Helm, you can use our OCI Repository.

helm install mychart oci://tccr.io/truecharts/CHARTNAME

For more information on how to install TrueCharts Helm charts, checkout the instructions on the website: https://truecharts.org/helm/

TrueNAS SCALE Apps

For more information on how to use TrueCharts as TrueNAS SCALE Apps, please checkout the quick-start guides for TrueNAS SCALE.

Configuration Options

To view the chart specific options, please view Values.yaml included in the chart.

All our Charts use a shared "common" library chart that contains most of the templating and options. For the complete overview of all available options, please checkout the documentation for them on the website: https://truecharts.org/common/

Chart Specific Guides and information

All our charts have dedicated documentation pages. The documentation for this chart can be found here: https://truecharts.org/charts/incubator/volsync

Support

  • See the Website
  • Check our Discord
  • Open a issue

Sponsor TrueCharts

TrueCharts can only exist due to the incredible effort of our staff. Please consider making a donation or contributing back to the project any way you can!

All Rights Reserved - The TrueCharts Project
